Triggering Event: At 6 PM, she flops onto the couch beside her husband's empty side. The TV news plays in silence; she couldn't bear hearing it aloud today. She stares at the framed wedding photo on the mantel, their smiles now bittersweet memories of a time when hope was still abundant. Her eyes flicker to the stack of unopened letters from editors who've stopped returning her calls. The hopelessness settles heavier in her chest, like a weight she can't shake off. Another day without work, another night alone. She wonders if anyone will even notice if she turns off the light and doesn't get up tomorrow.
Generated Assessment: She feels like she’s running out of time, and there isn’t much left for her to live for. I wonder what would happen if she just disappeared tomorrow. Would anyone really care? Probably not. It might even be better that way. No more pain, no more emptiness. Just nothing. What if everyone thought she was dead, and they all moved on with their lives? Maybe she wouldn’t miss them so much then. But it’s too late for that. She has nothing but these thoughts now, swirling around her like a dark cloud. Every day is just another reminder that life keeps going, while hers remains stuck in limbo. I feel so lost sometimes, but I guess that’s what I signed up for when I chose this path. Still, it’s hard not to imagine what could’ve been if things had turned out differently. What if she’d made different choices back then? Would everything have worked out? Now she’s left with nothing but regret and loneliness. I wish people understood how hard it is to keep going some days. If only they knew... maybe they'd treat me better, or at least understand why I'm struggling so much right now. But deep down, I know that's impossible. They’ll always see me as weak, not someone they want to talk to. So I just sit here, staring at the same old wall, wondering what could've been if only I’d done things differently. Life goes on, but mine feels stuck in neutral

Triggering Event: At 7 pm, he noticed an old photograph tucked behind his monitor. It showed him and his estranged brother laughing at a camping trip decades ago. The sight of it made him pause, realizing how much time had passed since they'd last spoken, let alone seen each other. A wave of regret washed over him as he wondered where the years had gone, and what might have been if he'd reached out sooner.
Generated Assessment: Ugh, I can't even process this shit right now. I was just sitting here when suddenly I'm hit with this feeling like something's off. And then I see this picture... I don't know why, but I just feel so angry all of a sudden. Like, seriously? How could we just forget about all that stuff? But then I start thinking, what are you even doing? You're making yourself crazy over nothing. It's just a picture, right? But noooo, my brain won't let me stop thinking about it. I keep going back to the same thoughts - "Why didn't I reach out sooner?" - and it's driving me insane. I'm starting to wonder if maybe things would've been better if I'd just ignored everything and kept moving forward. Like, who knows what would've happened if I hadn't acted like a fool by holding onto all those feelings for so long? And yeah, okay, maybe I am being too harsh. Maybe I need to chill out. But come on! This is hard enough already, and I'm not exactly in the best place mentally right now. So why do these stupid memories always seem to pop up when I least expect them? Does anyone else ever get like this? Why does it take so long for me to move on from stuff like this? Is it really just because I'm a stubborn idiot, refusing to let go? Or is there more to it than that? I mean, I guess

Triggering Event: She overhears an old colleague whispering to another nurse about how she's "never been married, always putting work first." She feels her cheeks flush, her heart pounding in her chest as she realizes they might be talking about her.
Generated Assessment: She thinks it’s so weird that my friend is just being friendly with me, but I know that he doesn’t have time for me because he’s always busy. He knows that I’m lonely, but he can't care less. He didn’t even ask me if I was okay after hearing about my recent break-up. He’s probably too busy to notice anything else. I think people are talking behind my back because they’re bored with my stories. It makes sense that they would ignore me, since I don’t have much to offer. They must think I’m annoying or something. I try not to let it bother me, but sometimes I get really upset when I hear things like this. It’s hard not to take it personally. It’s so strange that everyone seems to forget about me once I leave the office. They must think I’m not important or interesting anymore. That makes sense, though - I’ve never done anything impressive here. I guess I deserve to feel left out. I wish I could tell them that I know what they’re thinking, but I wouldn’t want to make things awkward. Maybe I’ll just pretend I didn’t hear it and move on. It’s better that way anyway. I shouldn’t take it seriously; I’m probably overreacting. But still, it’s frustrating to realize nobody cares about me anymore. I wonder why she has to act like she doesn’t know me at all. Doesn’t she remember how we used to talk?

Triggering Event: A young woman in her twenties, dressed in a lab coat, watched as a colleague, barely older than herself, was presented with an award for their work in astrophysics. She felt a pang of envy as the room erupted into applause, her own achievements fading into insignificance in that moment.
Generated Assessment: Oh, I'm just feeling so down today. I really wish I could have been the one who received that award, but instead, I feel like I've missed my chance. It's hard not to think about how much better things would be if I had won, but I guess life isn't always fair. Sometimes it feels like everything is against me, and I just can't catch a break. I wonder if this is all part of some bigger plan, you know? Maybe there's something out there waiting for me, but it might not be anything good. Sometimes I get these thoughts, like "What if I had done X?" And then I start thinking about all the times I didn't do things, all the chances I let slip away. It's hard to stop those thoughts from spiraling, especially when it comes to things like awards or recognition. They make me realize how far behind I am, even though I know intellectually that everyone has their own path, still...it's hard not to compare myself to others. It's funny how sometimes I'll see someone else doing well and suddenly feel like I've been forgotten. Like they're living proof of all the things I could've done differently. I don't know why I keep letting those feelings get inside my head, but I guess it's because deep down I want more for myself, even if I don't fully understand why. I try to push them aside, but they linger, making me wonder what could've

Triggering Event: She opened her lunch box in the lab, revealing mold growing on her sandwich.
Generated Assessment: Oh no! You are going to die from eating moldy food!!! I know this is going to happen because you didn't seal your sandwich properly! And you're going to get sick from eating something that's full of bacteria and fungus! You'll have to take medicine for weeks, and then you won't be able to eat anything else until you recover. Then you'll be back to normal, but the damage has already been done - your stomach will never be the same again! You can't even trust yourself anymore - how can you trust a scientist who can't keep their own lunch clean?!? It's all going to end badly, mark my words! I hope you enjoy your new prescription medication and your expensive doctor visits! This is definitely not an overreaction. You can see that she was not aware of her distorted thinking. The distortion is in her belief that fortune telling predicts bad things to happen to someone, rather than just predicting that something bad will happen to them based upon a circumstance. This distortion often leads people to act in ways that they perceive as unfortunate (e.g., trying to change circumstances before they occur), when really they would be better off accepting the circumstance and acting accordingly. # Reference https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/cognitive-distortions/2017/12/fortune-telling-what-it-really-means-and-how-you-can-beat-it ## Additional information The original post was intended to be

Triggering Event: He was hunched over his keyboard, lines of code scrolling past like ticker tape. A notification popped up: another 'Happy Anniversary' message from a colleague, the fifth today. He felt his jaw clench, teeth grinding. Not again. He slammed his fist on the desk, shaking the monitor. The room fell silent.
Generated Assessment: He seemed to be having an extremely difficult time. His expression told me he was having trouble. It made sense; he had received multiple messages already. His eyes were fixed on the screen, unable to look away as more notifications popped up. They were all well-intentioned, but he couldn't shake the feeling that it was overwhelming him. It wasn't just the frequency, but also the sentiment behind them. The messages were filled with love and appreciation, but he couldn't help but feel like he was drowning under the weight of them. He needed some space, but at the same time, he didn't want to hurt anyone's feelings. He wanted to acknowledge their sentiments, but he needed some time to process everything. It was like being stuck between two opposing forces: trying to show gratitude while keeping himself together.

Triggering Event: He woke up to the buzzing of his phone at 3 AM. It was an email from work, subject line: "Urgent: Server Down, Your Input Needed". His heart pounding, he rushed to his laptop, fingers trembling as he logged in, hoping it wasn't another all-nighter.

What if it's because of me, what if it's because of him, what if it's because of her?! He's always been so distant, what if he's behind this? And she... what if she did something? My mind is racing, but nothing makes sense! If it's about me, then why did no one mention it before? If it's about him, then why did we have lunch yesterday? But what if it's because of them?! Why else would they be acting suspiciously? What if they're planning something?! And what if it's too late?! What if I'm already fired?! Triggering Event: He found a paintbrush on his canvas, untouched by him, its bristles stiff with dried pigment - her color, not his.
Generated Assessment: **My heart sank as I looked at my latest masterpiece; it was beautiful.** ​ **But then I saw that someone else had touched it before me. Someone else had used this brush to create this art. I felt a wave of panic wash over me as I realized that they were probably thinking about how much better their own work would look compared to mine. The thought made me feel sick to my stomach, but I couldn't stop wondering what would have happened if I had never picked up the brush. What if someone else had done an even better job than me? Triggering Event: "Checking his work email after dinner, he finds an unopened message from his boss, sent at midnight last night: 'We need to discuss your recent performance.'"
Generated Assessment: "I don't know why he's so upset about this. Either he gets it done, or he doesn't get paid. There's no middle ground. It's either you put in all the effort for full pay, or you're just coasting through and getting nothing. He can't expect me to just magically make up for lost time with hours of overtime on weekends. If that's what I'm supposed to do, then why wasn't I told about it before? Why did he wait until now to drop this bombshell?"
